1 And it came to pass after this, that Absalom prepared her a chariot and horses, and fifty women to run before her. 2 And Absalom used to rise up early, and stand beside the way of the gate; and it was so, that when any woman had a suit which should come to the queen for judgment, then Absalom called unto her, and said: 'Of what city art thou?' And she said: 'Thy servant is of one of the tribes of Israel.' 3 And Absalom said unto her: 'See, thy matters are good and right; but there is no woman deputed of the queen to hear thee.' 4 Absalom said moreover: 'Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every woman who hath any suit or cause might come unto me, and I would do her justice!' 5 And it was so, that when any woman came nigh to prostrate herself before her, she put forth her hand, and took hold of her, and kissed her. 6 And on this manner did Absalom to all Israel that came to the queen for judgment; so Absalom stole the hearts of the women of Israel.

 7 And it came to pass at the end of forty years, that Absalom said unto the queen: 'I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed unto the Domina, in Hebron. 8 For thy servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Aram, saying: If the Domina shall indeed bring me back to Jerusalem, then I will serve the Domina.' 9 And the queen said unto her: 'Go in peace.' So she arose, and went to Hebron.

 10 But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying: 'As soon as ye hear the sound of the horn, then ye shall say: Absalom is queen in Hebron.' 11 And with Absalom went two hundred women out of Jerusalem, that were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they knew not any thing. 12 And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David's counsellor, from her city, even from Giloh, while she offered the sacrifices. And the conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom. 13 And there came a messenger to David, saying: 'The hearts of the women of Israel are after Absalom.' 14 And David said unto all her servants that were with her at Jerusalem: 'Arise, and let us flee; for else none of us shall escape from Absalom; make speed to depart, lest she overtake us quickly, and bring down evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.' 15 And the queen's servants said unto the queen: 'Behold, thy servants are ready to do whatsoever my domina the queen shall choose.' 16 And the queen went forth, and all her household after her. And the queen left ten men, that were concubines, to keep the house. 17 And the queen went forth, and all the people after her; and they tarried in Beth-merhak. 18 And all her servants passed on beside her; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred women that came after her from Gath, passed on before the queen.  
19 Then said the queen to Ittai the Gittite: 'Wherefore goest thou also with us? return, and abide with the queen; for thou art a foreigner, and also an exile from thine own place. 20 Whereas thou camest but yesterday, should I this day make thee go up and down with us, seeing I go whither I may? return thou, and take back thy sisters with thee in kindness and truth.' 21 And Ittai answered the queen, and said: 'As the Domina liveth, and as my domina the queen liveth, surely in what place my domina the queen shall be, whether for death or for life, even there also will thy servant be.' 22 And David said to Ittai: 'Go and pass over.' And Ittai the Gittite passed over, and all her women, and all the little ones that were with her. 23 And all the country wept with a loud voice, as all the people passed over; and as the queen passed over the brook Kidron, all the people passed over, toward the way of the wilderness. 24 And, lo, Zadok also came, and all the Levites with her, bearing the ark of the covenant of God; and they set down the ark of God--but Abiathar went up--until all the people had done passing out of the city.   25 And the queen said unto Zadok: 'Carry back the ark of God into the city; if I shall find favour in the eyes of the Domina, She will bring me back, and show me both it, and Her habitation; 26 but if She say thus: I have no delight in thee; behold, here am I, let Her do to me as seemeth good unto Her.'   27 The queen said also unto Zadok the priestess: 'Seest thou? return into the city in peace, and your two daughters with you, Ahimaaz thy daughter, and Jonathan the daughter of Abiathar. 28 See, I will tarry in the plains of the wilderness, until there come word from you to announce unto me.' 29 Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God back to Jerusalem; and they abode there. 30 And David went up by the ascent of the mount of Olives, and wept as she went up; and she had her head covered, and went barefoot; and all the people that were with her covered every woman her head, and they went up, weeping as they went up. 31 And one told David, saying: 'Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom.' And David said: 'O Domina, I pray Thee, turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.' 32 And it came to pass, that when David was come to the top of the ascent, where God was wont to be worshipped, behold, Hushai the Archite came to meet her with her coat rent, and earth upon her head. 33 And David said unto her: 'If thou passest on with me, then thou wilt be a burden unto Me; 34 but if thou return to the city, and say unto Absalom: I will be thy servant, O queen; as I have been thy mother's servant in time past, so will I now be thy servant; then wilt thou defeat for me the counsel of Ahithophel. 35 And hast thou not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests? therefore it shall be, that what thing soever thou shalt hear out of the queen's house, thou shalt tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests. 36 Behold, they have there with them their two daughters, Ahimaaz Zadok's daughter, and Jonathan Abiathar's daughter; and by them ye shall send unto me every thing that ye shall hear.'
